question: Never resting, never still. Moving silently from hill to hill. It does not walk, run or trot. All is cool where it is not. What is it?
What object has keys that open no locks, space but no room, and you can enter but not go in?
What is that which goes with a car, comes with a car, is of no use to a car, and yet the car cannot go without it?
I have two arms, but fingers none. I have two feet, but cannot run. I carry well, but I have found I carry best with my feet off the ground. What am I?
What do you throw out when you want to use it, but take in when you don't want to use it?
It is an insect, and the first part of its name is the name of another insect. What is it?
I'm the part of the bird that's not in the sky. I can swim in the ocean and yet remain dry. What am I?
Feed me and I live, give me something to drink and I'll die. What am I?
What word of five letters has only one left when two letters are removed?
You hear it speak, for it has a hard tongue. But it cannot breathe, for it has not a lung. What is it?
Take off my skin and I won't cry, but you will. What am I?
What is made of wood, but can't be sawed?
Different lights do make me strange, thus into different sizes I will change. What am I?
The more of them you take, the more you leave behind. What are they?
What five-letter word becomes shorter when you add two letters?
Lives without a body, hears without ears, speaks without a mouth, to which the air alone gives birth. What is it?
What do you break every time you name it?
What turns everything around, but does not move?
I have a face, two arms, and two hands, yet I can not move. I count to twelve, yet I can not speak. I can still tell you something every day. What am I?
What doesn't get any wetter, no matter how much rain falls on it?
What is harder to catch the faster you run?
The person who makes it has no need for it. The person who purchases it does not use it. The person who does use it does not know he or she is. What is it?
I am lighter than air but a million men cannot lift me up, What am I?
Forward I am heavy, backwards I am not. What am I?
What is it that no-one ever yet did see, which never was, but always is to be?
